newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria contains outbreak of cattle disease.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria contains outbreak of cattle disease.

text.p: Bulgaria's National Veterinary Service (NVS) said on Tuesday an outbreak of foot-and-mouth disease in the southeast had been contained and trade would resume in about three months.
"The ban on livestock trade will be lifted three months after the quarantine is over," NVS deputy director Andrei Kozarev told Reuters.
Bulgaria suspended livestock exports and trade two weeks ago in an effort to contain the outbreak in Malko Sharkovo, near the border with Turkey.
The quarantine will end 20 days after the last contaminated animal was slaughtered, which was on November 10, said Kozarev.
Last week Romania suspended livestock imports from its southern neighbour following the outbreak.
